alfredsnippet.snippet:
"It must be remembered that nothing is more difficult to plan, and more doubtful of success, nor more dangerous to manage than the creation of a new system. For the initiator has the enmity of all who would profit from the preservation of the old institution and merely lukewarm defenders of those who would gain by the new ones ...  [There exists a] general skepticism of mankind which does not really believe in an innovation until experience proves its value."

- Nicolo Machiavelli (1469-1527), The Prince
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Machiavelli on Innovation
